Verify A Phone


You can also enable Google Authenticator and SMS access.

Enable Google Authenticator Support

  1. Install the Google Authenticator app on your mobile device.
  2. Scan the QR code below with the mobile app (or click/tap it if you're using a mobile device).
  3. Once complete you can use Google Authenticator tokens for two-factor authentication.

Close

What is Two-Factor Authentication?

Enabling two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. In addition to your regular password, it will require a pin code from your cell phone to sign in.

This makes it much more difficult for someone to gain unauthorized access to your account since it requires both something you know (your password) and something you own (your phone).

Once you have a verified phone number on your account, two-factor authentication will be enabled.

If you lose your phone you will need to go through our reset process to restore access.

Alternatively, you can add a backup phone number (a friend, relative, or someone you trust) in case you lose access to your primary phone. You don't have to verify the backup phone number but adding it will send an SMS to that number.

We also support Google Authenticator for two-factor authentication, but verifying a real phone number (via SMS or call) is still required for account validation purposes if you wish to purchase bitcoin.
